SENT.plain: Marfanoid phenotype with craniosynostosis (Shprintzen-Goldberg syndrome) is a rare disorder previously described in only 5 patients
We report on the sixth known patient with this condition

The findings which distinguish our patient from others reported previously are that she was ascertained prenatally as having a cloverleaf skull; this is the first female patient described with this condition
Postnatally, she presented with arachnodactyly, camptodactyly, and clover-leaf skull
Imaging studies of the brain documented microcephaly with malformed brain, hydrocephaly, and hypoplasia of the corpus callosum
She also had choanal atresia and stenosis, a clinical finding previously reported only once, in this disorder
